{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3489034,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T17:48:18.669Z","cooked":"

Our team has used the Rev Through Bore Encoder connected to the Spark Max Alternate Encoder port as our Feedback Device for the Spark Max motor controller multiple times in the past. We basically just followed Rev’s examples for this and everything worked splendidly. However, we haven’t figured out how to do this with the 2025 library. We’ve looked at the migration guide and found many examples that helped us get our other functions working, but cannot find an example for this use case. Can someone help please? Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T17:48:18.669Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":231,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":1197.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3489131,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T19:40:08.543Z","cooked":"

Throw this in the configuration for that motor controller

armconf.closedLoop.feedbackSensor(FeedbackSensor.kAbsoluteEncoder);

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T19:40:08.543Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/2","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3489237,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T21:27:31.761Z","cooked":"

Thanks. Actually trying to use it as a relative encoder but assuming same type of thing. Do you know of any examples out there that deal with setting the specifics of the relative encoder? All the stuff in the configs I’m sure, but would be nice to see an example to ensure we’re not doing anything wrong. I’m surprised Rev doesn’t have examples out there for this and wondering if I’m not looking in the right places.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T21:27:31.761Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":57.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3489430,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-22T01:20:40.178Z","cooked":"

I think in that case you want the same line, but FeedbackSensor.kAlternateOrExternalEncoder.

That said, I’m not sure exactly that this does what you want. We haven’t used this, for the simple fact that if we’re plugging in a through-bore encoder, it’s to read the absolute position of an effector. Using the through-bore encoder as a relative encoder on a spark max is relatively redundant, since it’s providing the same data as the primary motor encoders.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-22T01:20:40.178Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56643,"username":"aveeser","name":"4391 Programming Mentor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/4","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3489504,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-22T03:03:01.715Z","cooked":"

We’ve found that measuring rotations of a shaft that is a few gears or “linkages” away from the controlling motor can be much more accurate than measuring at the motor itself. I think we got the syntax figured out now (no alarms) but won’t be able to test for a couple days yet. Thanks!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-22T03:03:01.715Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552832,"name":"Andres","username":"A_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/da6949/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T16:04:39.078Z","cooked":"

Hey, we have been having problems with the through bore encoder as we have used it in the past as a duty cycle encoder and has worked great but now the encoder resets to 0 after one rotation. Which doesn’t allow us to have out elevator go up. Could you tell us what yo did to make it work?
Thank you.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T16:04:39.078Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":20.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"Andres","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56643,"username":"aveeser","name":"4391 Programming Mentor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59525,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552859,"name":"","username":"cmdrkien","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/54ee81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T16:19:30.178Z","cooked":"

Sounds like you have it attached as an absolute encoder. You need the alternate encoder board, and have it set as FeedbackSensor.kAlternateOrExternalEncoder .

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T16:19:30.178Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":30.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482898,"topic_slug":"rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59525,"username":"A_C","name":"Andres","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/da6949/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69896,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-2025-using-through-bore-encoder-as-alternate-encoder/482898/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552873,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T16:24:46.835Z","cooked":"

Agreed! We use duty cycle for things like wrists that don’t go more than one rotation. If multiple rotations, like elevator shaft, use as alternate relative encoder.
